info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 07 at 3:45AM PST until December 08 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 10 PM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected with accumulations of 4 to 8 inches expected, with higher amounts above 4500 feet. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph and blowing snow. * WHERE...Portions of Siskiyou County. This includes, highway 3 south of Callahan, I-5 from Weed south to Dunsmuir and near Hilt, and Highway 89 from from the I-5 exit east to Pondosa. * WHEN...From 10 PM Wednesday to 10 PM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult due to reduced visibility from blowing snow and slick roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The period of heaviest snowfall will be from 10 AM through 7 PM PST. There is a 30% chance that snowfall rates reach one inch per hour during this time. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow could cause travel difficulties.
